entry.title: The Foundation Is Back
entry.summary:
Author: edmundodiazjr

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,194Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 1

Summary: After weeks of living in that suspended, awful limbo—the kind where time doesn’t feel real and every breath is borrowed—Buck still couldn’t shake the image of Eddie’s lifeless body being rolled into the ER. Twice they had to bring him back. Twice Buck felt something in him die and claw itself back to life.So no, he didn’t eat. He didn’t sleep. And he sure as hell didn’t leave Eddie’s bedside. He just sat there, orbiting him like some desperate moon that forgot how to be anything else.Because even after the breakup… even after the silence so thick it felt like drowning… Buck never stopped loving him. Not for a second.So when Eddie stirred — a tiny shift, a muffled groan — Buck’s whole world jolted. He shot upright so fast his neck cracked. Is he—?OR; continuation of the fic small cracks become visible. read this first

entry.title: Second Chances
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 391,224Chapters: 47/?Kudos: 60

Summary: Bobby and Athena are just two people trying to put their lives back together while figuring out how to co-parent. What starts as a complicated plan to foster kids in need slowly turns into something much deeper. Through the ups and downs of heartbreak, healing, and raising children who’ve been through so much, they find strength in each other. Over time, their partnership grows into love, and together, they build a story about family, trust, and second chances.

entry.title: Evergrowing
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 259,919Chapters: 42/?Kudos: 20

Summary: Athena and Bobby are learning that parenting doesn’t end when the kids turn eighteen. With three grown children and two still at home, Bobby and Athena find themselves navigating new challenges at every stage of life. Each child carries their own struggles, some spoken and some hidden, but together the family works through the ups and downs with love, patience, and resilience. At the heart of it all, they’re reminded that family is a bond that grows, shifts, and deepens, no matter how old the kids get.

entry.title: Lovestruck in the City
entry.summary:
Author: kermits1995

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,415Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 48

Summary: “You know what I hate the most?” Buck asked, voice small, eyes glistening as they met Eddie’s. “That it’s not hard for me to believe you could’ve moved on so quickly. Because when we broke up…Eddie... you didn’t even fight for us.” The words detonated in Eddie’s chest, a sudden destruction that stole his breath. His mouth fell open, breath caught somewhere between protest and apology. Did I even have the right?  “Maybe I’m just a hopeless romantic,” Buck said with a cynical laugh, “but you didn’t even argue. Didn’t offer us a grace period. Like you were one foot out the door, and all you needed was that final nudge from me. You didn’t even look back.” “But hey,” he said, voice raw and wrecked, “good to finally know where we stand. Eddie Diaz is doing good, ladies and gentlemen,” Buck said with a wry, self‑mocking edge to his voice. “Guess he didn’t love me as much as I loved him.”   OR: the breaking-up and making-up fic.

entry.title: Postcards From LA
entry.summary:
Author: catniss_37

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,347Chapters: 1/11Kudos: 4

Summary: Eddie catches that redeye flight back to El Paso and returns to life in Texas with Christopher, and everything is as it should be. It's different and juggling Christopher, basic training, his grief is hard, and adapting to living with his parents right there to question his every move is complicated, but here with Christopher is where he's meant to be. Right? But when Eddie gets a postcard in the mail from one Evan "Buck" Buckley, suddenly he's reminded that maybe everything isn't as fine as it seems and that everything important isn't just here in Texas.

entry.title: The fire in your eyes
entry.summary:
Author: blackrose_17

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,334Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 84

Summary: Taking a step forward, Eddie's eyes didn't leave Buck's. "Did he kiss you?" He asked his voice in a low growl when Buck nodded. Eddie felt the jealousy erupt like a volcano, "then he stopped being my friend the moment he kissed you and abandoned you like you were nothing. It is your choice and your choice alone when you want to come out. He had no right to try to push you into something you weren't ready to tell me." Closing the distance between them, Eddie rested his hand on Buck's cheek as he admitted in a husky tone, "But the reason he stopped being my friend is he dared to kiss what is mine." Buck's date first date with Tommy ended in a disaster but that's okay his heart ended up with the one it was always destined to be with.

entry.title: Never a Frown (With Golden Brown)
entry.summary:
Author: ratking_withnotail

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 63,235Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 383

Summary: Percy Jackson was excited—genuinely excited—for the first time in what felt like years. A new city. A new name. A new face, even. The golden hair, the pale blue eyes, the tattoos that traced his skin like constellations—none of it screamed “Percy Jackson” anymore. He was Evan Buckley now, or just Buck, depending on who asked. He’d keep busy—physically exhausted, mentally occupied, emotionally detached. That was the key. No attachments. No friendships. No relationships. No vulnerability. He’d learned the hard way that getting close to people only ended in pain. Either they died, betrayed him, or saw the legend behind the name and stopped seeing him altogether.Unfortunately, he hadn’t planned on the 118.

entry.title: You’re the Sun to Me
entry.summary:
Author: ScribblesAfterDark

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 22,916Chapters: 13/?Kudos: 146

Summary: “Speaking of…you got any idea what this lunch is about? She was pretty vague when she called.” Buck paused, then he shook his head, a small frown pulling between his brows. “Nope. Not a clue.” “But you’re worried,” Eddie guessed. Buck gave a half-shrug, trying for casual, though his hand lingered at Tori’s side like the contact grounded him. “Maddie doesn’t usually do vague. If she says she wants to talk, she wants to talk.” Tori let out a babble just then, saving him from saying more. Buck leaned down, pressing a kiss to the top of her head before scooping her into his arms. “Guess we’ll find out soon enough.” Eddie studied him for a moment. Buck’s answering smile was soft but a little distracted, like his mind was already skipping ahead to lunch. And Eddie couldn’t shake the feeling that Maddie’s words would upend the equilibrium they’d worked so hard to hold. Or, After years of chaos, they’ve built a life full of love and family, but a hidden secret from Buck’s past threatens their fragile peace. When the past collides with the present, even the happiest home feels uncertain.
